ilo: Have a comprehensive understanding of the process and practice of research in Information Systems
Describe and critically appraise the role of published research, precedent, prior art, patents and standards in Information Systems
Develop expertise in the area of their research project
Be able to effectively articulate and communicate the impact of their research outcomes to the wider community; and
Demonstrate proficiency in analytical, problem-solving, and research skills.
generic_skills: Communicating their research in scholarly reports and in public presentations; and

Prerequisites.content: Must have a mark of 75% in COMP90044 OR ISYS90118
Have a WAM of at least 75%

In addition, no candidate will be allowed to enrol until a topic has been negotiated with a supervisor, a supervisor has agreed to supervise, and the topic approved by the course coordinator. This approval must be obtained well prior (at least 2 weeks) to the start of a semester. To meet this deadline, candidates are strongly advised to start selecting and negotiating topics and supervisors once they have completed COMP90044 or ISYS90118.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief:
One thesis (90%) of approximately 7500 words requiring approximately 250 hours of work. 



Supervisors will set mid-project milestones as part of the thesis work.



Intended Learning Outcomes (ILO's) 1 to 5 are addressed in the thesis.
assessment.hurdle: The thesis is a hurdle and must be passed to pass the subject.
assessment.timing: During the exam period for ISYS90110

assessment.brief:
One 15-minute oral presentation (10%), requiring approximately 50 hours of work. 



ILO's 1 to 5 are addressed in the oral presentation.
assessment.hurdle: The oral presentation is a hurdle and must be passed to pass the subject.

date_times.contact_hours: This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.
This subject is an individual research project and weekly contact hours will vary depending on the nature of the project.
